rubric_items.passed_description: App is written solely in the Java Programming Language.
rubric_items.criteria: App is written solely in the Java Programming Language.

rubric_items.passed_description: Movies are displayed in the main layout via a grid of their corresponding movie poster thumbnails.
rubric_items.criteria: Movies are displayed in the main layout via a grid of their corresponding movie poster thumbnails.

rubric_items.passed_description: UI contains an element (i.e a spinner or settings menu) to toggle the sort order of the movies by: most popular, highest rated.
rubric_items.criteria: UI contains an element (i.e a spinner or settings menu) to toggle the sort order of the movies by: most popular, highest rated.

rubric_items.passed_description: UI contains a screen for displaying the details for a selected movie.
rubric_items.criteria: UI contains a screen for displaying the details for a selected movie.

rubric_items.passed_description: Movie details layout contains title, release date, movie poster, vote average, and plot synopsis.
rubric_items.criteria: Movie details layout contains title, release date, movie poster, vote average, and plot synopsis.

rubric_items.passed_description: App utilizes stable release versions of all libraries, Gradle, and Android Studio.
rubric_items.criteria: Submission must use stable release versions of all libraries, Gradle, and Android Studio. Debug/beta/canary versions are not acceptable.

rubric_items.passed_description: When a user changes the sort criteria (“most popular and highest rated”) the main view gets updated correctly.
rubric_items.criteria: When a user changes the sort criteria (“most popular and highest rated”) the main view gets updated correctly.

rubric_items.passed_description: When a movie poster thumbnail is selected, the movie details screen is launched.
rubric_items.criteria: When a movie poster thumbnail is selected, the movie details screen is launched.

rubric_items.passed_description: In a background thread, app queries the `/movie/popular` or `/movie/top_rated` API for the sort criteria specified in the settings menu.
rubric_items.criteria:
In a background thread, app queries the /movie/popular or /movie/top_rated API for the sort criteria specified in the settings menu.

**OR**

**Acceptable until April 8, 2016**: In a background thread, app queries the /discover/movies API with the query parameter for the sort criteria specified in the settings menu. (Note: Each sorting criteria is a different API call.)

This query can also be used to fetch the related metadata needed for the detail view.

rubric_items.passed_description: App conforms to common standards found in the [Android Nanodegree General Project Guidelines](http://udacity.github.io/android-nanodegree-guidelines/core.html) (NOTE: For Stage 1 of the Popular Movies App, it is okay if the app does not restore the data using `onSaveInstanceState`/`onRestoreInstanceState`)
rubric_items.criteria:
App conforms to common standards found in the [Android Nanodegree General Project Guidelines](http://udacity.github.io/android-nanodegree-guidelines/core.html) 
(NOTE: For Stage 1 of the Popular Movies App, it is okay if the app does not restore the data using onSaveInstanceState/onRestoreInstanceState)
